info.title: Starweb Shop API v.2
info.description: This API is only allowed to be used by partners of Starweb AB and further requires explicit permission from both Starweb AB and the shop owner. If you are interested in using it, please contact us at starwebapi@starweb.se . Change log for this API can be found at: https://sws.local/API-CHANGELOG.md

shopId.description: The shopId of the shop you want to connect to

\/token.summary: Generate and fetch new access token

post.description: Create a token. Retrieves the create `Token` object.

get.description: Returns a list of currencies supported by the shop
Retrieves the details of a currency

\/customers.summary: Get shop orders or create a new one

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of customers to return

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort the result using a specified field. customerId is default. Valid options are: customerId

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: ASC for an ascending sort order; or DESC for a descending sort order. DESC is default

parameters.name: createdSince
parameters.description: Use this to only fetch customers that has been created since a certain time. The time should be formatted using ISO-8601 (url encoded)

parameters.name: updatedSince
parameters.description: Use this to only fetch customers that has been modified since a certain time. The time should be formatted using ISO-8601 (url encoded)

parameters.name: includeWithoutAccount
parameters.description: Use this to also include customers without an account

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: If you want to include child data in the result. Example: ?include=tags (to include customer tags); ?include=tags,addresses (to include both customer tags and addresses). Available includes: tags, externalServices, addresses

post.description: Creates a `Customer` object

201.description: The created customer is returned

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: If you want to include child data in the result. Example: ?include=tags (to include customer tags); ?include=tags,addresses (to include both customer tags and addresses). Available includes: tags, externalServices, addresses

put.description: Updates a customer. Retrieves the updated `Customer` object

patch.description: Updates a customer. Retrieves the updated `Customer` object

\/orders.summary: Get shop orders or create a new one

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of orders to return

parameters.name: includeNonCompletePayments
parameters.description: Set to true if you want to fetch orders that has not been completed yet. An order is ”completed” when the payment step has been completed successfully.

parameters.name: filterQuery
parameters.description: A filter query to filter the fetched orders by. Will search in fields such as: customer/company name, order items sku and description, etc

parameters.name: filterPaymentMethodId
parameters.description: Only fetch orders with a certain payment method Id

parameters.name: filterShippingMethodId
parameters.description: Only fetch orders with a certain shipping method Id

parameters.name: ordersCreatedAfter
parameters.description: Only fetch orders created after this timestamp (The time should be formatted using ISO-8601 and url encoded)

parameters.name: ordersCreatedBefore
parameters.description: Only fetch orders created before this timestamp (The time should be formatted using ISO-8601 and url encoded)

parameters.name: statusFilter
parameters.description: Only fetch orders with the specifiec order status. Use order status ID

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort the result using a specified field. orderId is default

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: ASC for an ascending sort order; or DESC for a descending sort order. DESC is default

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: If you want to include child data in the result. Example: ?include=items (to include order items) or ?include=items,externalServices (to include order items as well as external ids). or ?include=items.bundledItems (to include items and bundled items)Available includes: items, externalServices, status, customer, addresses

post.description: Create an order. Retrieves the create `Order` object

201.description: The created order is returned

post.description: Create a tag option. Tag options can only be created for tags of type `option`. If you try to create options for a tag of type `boolean` an error `405` will be returned. Returns the created `ProductTagOption` object.

201.description: The created productTagOption is returned

delete.description: Delete a tag option permanently. Tag options can only be deleted for tags of type `option`. If you try to delete a tag option for a tag of any other type an error `405` will be returned.

put.description: Update a tag option. Tag options can only be updated for tags of type `option`. If you try to update a tag option for a tag of any other type an error `405` will be returned. Returns the updated `ProductTagOption` object.

patch.description: Partially updates a tag option. Tag options can only be updates for tags of type `option`. If you try to update a tag option for a tag of any other type an error `405` will be returned. Returns the updated `ProductTagOption` object.

200.description: The updated tag option is returned

\/products.summary: Get products or create a new one

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of products to return

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort the result using a specified field. productId is default. Valid options are: productId

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: ASC for an ascending sort order; or DESC for a descending sort order. ASC is default

parameters.name: createdSince
parameters.description: Use this to only fetch products that has been created since a certain time. The time should be formatted using ISO-8601 (url encoded)

parameters.name: updatedSince
parameters.description: Use this to only fetch products that has been modified since a certain time. The time should be formatted using ISO-8601 (url encoded)

parameters.name: filterVisible
parameters.description: Only fetch products visible to visitors. Default is false.

parameters.name: filterSku
parameters.description: Only fetch a product with the specified SKU. Has to follow the pattern of /[A-Za-z0-9._-]+$/

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
If you want to include child data in the result. Example: ?include=primaryVariant (to include primary product variant);?include=primaryVariant,languages (to include both primary product variant and languages).

Available includes: `primaryVariant`, `primaryVariant.prices`, `primaryVariant.attributeValues`, `attributes`, `mediaFiles`, `languages`, `vatRates`, `categories`, `unit`, `metaData`, `bundledProducts`, `bundledProducts.prices`, `tags`.

NOTE! Only one variant and language is included in the result for performance reason. To fetch all variants, instead use /products/x/variants(unnecessary if hasSeveralVariants is false) and to fetch all languages for an object, instead use the individual objects language endpoint

languages.summary: include languages. Due to performance concerns only the primary language is included

primaryVariantPricesAndMediaFiles.summary: include primary variant prices and media files

attributes.summary: include attributes. Due to performance concerns only the primary language is included

unit.summary: include unit. Due to performance concerns only the primary language is included

metaData.summary: include metaData. Due to performance concerns only the primary language is included

post.description: Creates a product. Retrieves the created `Product` object.

201.description: The created product is returned

\/products\/{productId}.summary: Get or manipulate a certain product

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: If you want to include child data in the result. Example: ?include=variants (to include product variants); ?include=variants,languages (to include both product variants and languages). Available includes: `primaryVariant`, `primaryVariant.prices`, `mediaFiles`, `languages`, `vatRates`, `categories`, `unit`, `metaData`, `bundledProducts`, `bundledProducts.prices`, `tags`. NOTE! Only one variant is included in result for performance reason. To fetch all variants, instead use /products/x/variants (unnecessary if hasSeveralVariants is false)

delete.description: Deletes a product permanently.

put.description: Updates a product. Retrieves the update `Product` object.

patch.description: Updates a product. Retrieves the update `Product` object.

requestBody.description:
Web hook data
---
Please note that you should always use HTTPS when adding Webhooks in order to ensure security.




Also, there is no way to validate that the request originate from Starweb, so it is important that you always validate
these event with an API call. For example, if you receive a Webhook event regarding an order status update,
validate this and retrieve the actual data of that order using a GET to `/api/v2/orders/{order-id}`




All Webhook events will retry up to 10 times or until they get a 20x response. If they don't get a 20x response they
will retry again after 30 min.

---

All webhooks will POST to the URL and contain a JSON payload with the following fields:
---
- uuid (a UUID of this event, will be the same even if the event is resent due to none 20x response)
- eventId
- shopIdCode
- eventTimestamp

Additional fields depend on the event:
---
**product created / updated / deleted:**
- productId

**order created / updated / status-changed:**
- orderId
- shippingMethodId
- paymentMethodId
- orderStatusId
- orderStatusIdCode
- totalAmount
- currencyCode

\/web-hooks\/{webHookId}.summary: Get or manipulate a certain web hook

200.description: The updated web hook is returned
